short_summary: Providing vocational training on high-tech equipment for Indigenous inmates, specifically in the fields of heat press, vinyl, laser, and 3D printing, to enhance their skills and promote employability.
description: This procurement is for a pre-identified supplier who will provide vocational training on high-tech equipment to Indigenous inmates. The training will be held in a variety of locations across Quebec, including the Joliette Institution, Archambault Institution, and Federal Training Center. The supplier will be required to provide a range of equipment and resources, including heat press, vinyl, laser, and 3D printing machines, as well as instructional materials and staff. The training program will aim to enhance the skills of Indigenous inmates and promote their employability. The supplier must demonstrate four years of experience in providing holistic learning services to Indigenous clients, have at least two certified trainers with one year of experience in providing training on high-tech equipment, and have a specialized training stream for Indigenous female clients. The contract will be for a period of one year, with an option to extend for an additional year. The estimated value of the contract is $365,755.41. The procurement is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business and is not subject to any trade agreement. The closing date and time for submissions is July 14, 2023 at 14:00 PDT.

**Government Tender Announcement**

**Title**: Vocational Training on High-Tech Equipment for Indigenous Offenders

**Reference Number**: cb-6802-712279

**Publication Date**: June 29, 2023

**Closing Date**: July 14, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT

**Notice Type**: Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is seeking a supplier to provide vocational training on high-tech equipment for Indigenous offenders. The supplier will be required to deliver training programs that meet community standards and labour market conditions.

**Key Objectives**:

* Provide third-party certification courses in heat press, vinyl, laser, and 3D printing to Indigenous offender groups in federal institutions in the Quebec Region.
* Enhance vocational skills training for Indigenous offenders.
* Promote and encourage the participation of Indigenous offenders in learning programs.
* Provide access to employment and employability services in the community.

**Minimum Essential Requirements**:

* Four years of experience in providing holistic learning services to Indigenous clientele in a culturally appropriate manner.
* At least two certified trainers with one year of experience in providing training on high-tech equipment (heat press, vinyl, laser, and 3D printing).
* A specialized training stream for Indigenous female clientele.
* Established partnerships with Indigenous communities.

**Exclusions and Limited Tendering Reasons**: This procurement is not subject to any trade agreement or Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.

**Pre-Identified Supplier**: The First Peoples Innovation Centre is the only supplier able to offer training that respects and enhances Indigenous traditions.

**Statement of Capabilities**: Suppliers who meet the minimum essential requirements and are interested in bidding on this contract must submit a statement of capabilities by July 14, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT.

**Contact Information**: Linda Mandeville, Senior Procurement Officer, 340 Laurier Ave. W., Ottawa, ON K1A 0P9, Telephone: 438-357-6503, Email: [linda.mandeville@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:linda.mandeville@csc-scc.gc.ca)
